derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 17th cent.: from Italian, plural of broccolo 'cabbage sprout, head', diminutive brocco 'shoot', based on Latin brocchus, broccus 'projecting'

encyclopedia.content: 名词解释 broccoli n.（名词） 1. A vegetable (Brassica oleracea var. italica) in the mustard family, closely related to the cauliflower and having dense clusters of numerous green flower buds. 花椰菜，球花甘蓝：十字花科的一种蔬菜（甘蓝 芸苔属 变种 花茎甘蓝） ，与菜花紧密相关并有许多密实的绿色花苞束 2. The flower clusters of this plant, eaten as a vegetable before the flower buds open. 甘蓝花：这种

entry.def: Broccoli is a vegetable with green stalks and green or purple tops.

means.word_mean: 1. plant with dense clusters of tight green flower buds
